trans-unit.source: Updates a region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified path's interior

seg-source.mrk: Updates a region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified path's interior

target.mrk: Updates a region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified path's interior

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update the region

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update the region

target.mrk: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update the region

trans-unit.source: [optional] Combine mode that specifies how the region is combined with the path:

seg-source.mrk: Combine mode that specifies how the region is combined with the path:

target.mrk: Combine mode that specifies how the region is combined with the path:

trans-unit.source: 0 - The existing region is replaced by the new region

seg-source.mrk: 0 - The existing region is replaced by the new region

target.mrk: 0 - The existing region is replaced by the new region

trans-unit.source: 1 - The existing region is replaced by the intersection of itself and the new region

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The existing region is replaced by the intersection of itself and the new region

target.mrk: 1 - The existing region is replaced by the intersection of itself and the new region

trans-unit.source: 2 - The existing region is replaced by the union of itself and the new region

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The existing region is replaced by the union of itself and the new region

target.mrk: 2 - The existing region is replaced by the union of itself and the new region

trans-unit.source: 3 - The existing region is replaced by the result of performing an XOR on the two regions.

seg-source.mrk: 3 - The existing region is replaced by the result of performing an XOR on the two regions.

target.mrk: 3 - The existing region is replaced by the result of performing an XOR on the two regions.

trans-unit.source: A point is in the XOR of two regions if it is in one region or the other but not in both regions

seg-source.mrk: A point is in the XOR of two regions if it is in one region or the other but not in both regions

target.mrk: A point is in the XOR of two regions if it is in one region or the other but not in both regions

trans-unit.source: 4 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of itself that is outside of the new region

seg-source.mrk: 4 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of itself that is outside of the new region

target.mrk: 4 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of itself that is outside of the new region

trans-unit.source: 5 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of the new region that is outside of the existing region

seg-source.mrk: 5 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of the new region that is outside of the existing region

target.mrk: 5 - The existing region is replaced by the portion of the new region that is outside of the existing region

trans-unit.source: False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

seg-source.mrk: False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

target.mrk: False and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

trans-unit.source: Set window background color to blue

seg-source.mrk: Set window background color to blue

target.mrk: Set window background color to blue

trans-unit.source: Create string bounding rectangle X=0, Y=0

seg-source.mrk: Create string bounding rectangle X=0, Y=0

target.mrk: Create string bounding rectangle X=0, Y=0

trans-unit.source: Add the outline of the string to the path

seg-source.mrk: Add the outline of the string to the path

target.mrk: Add the outline of the string to the path

trans-unit.source: Create GDI region from GDI+ region

seg-source.mrk: Create GDI region from GDI+ region

target.mrk: Create GDI region from GDI+ region
